### canonicalizeMetadataForValue() {#a20a678afa540694502fca3ed77617af8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Metadata &#42; canonicalizeMetadataForValue (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> &amp; Context, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> &#42; MD)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Canonicalize metadata arguments to intrinsics.

To support bitcode upgrades (and assembly semantic sugar) for <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadataasvalue">MetadataAsValue</a></em>, we need to canonicalize certain metadata.


<ul>
<li>nullptr is replaced by an empty <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a>.</li>
<li>An <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a> with a single null operand is replaced by an empty <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a>.</li>
<li>An <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a> whose only operand is a <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantasmetadata">ConstantAsMetadata</a></em> gets skipped.</li>
</ul>


This maintains readability of bitcode from when metadata was a type of value, and these bridges were unnecessary.

Definition at line <a href="#l00081">81</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/metadata-cpp">Metadata.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getOrSelfReference() {#ac03fb37174ccf690b0e7e675b47fcb19}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static MDNode &#42; getOrSelfReference (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> &amp; Context, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> &#42; &gt; Ops)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Get a node or a self-reference that looks like it.

Special handling for finding self-references, for use by <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode/#a3279d6d110c594673e692308fce00fab">MDNode::concatenate()</a></em> and <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode/#acdbfda46c9837123ef7143244fc1f904">MDNode::intersect()</a></em> to maintain behaviour from when self-referencing nodes were still uniqued. If the first operand has the same operands as <code>Ops</code>, return the first operand instead.

Definition at line <a href="#l01100">1100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/metadata-cpp">Metadata.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<Link id="l01094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1094"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Get a node or a self-reference that looks like it.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1095"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1096"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Special handling for finding self-references, for use by \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MDNode::concatenate() and \\a MDNode::intersect() to maintain behaviour from</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the same operands as \\c Ops, return the first operand instead.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1285"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given two ranges, we want to compute the union of the ranges. This</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1286"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is slightly complicated by having to combine the intervals and merge</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1287"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the ones that overlap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1288"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1294"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1295"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// First, walk both lists in order of the lower boundary of each interval.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1296"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// At each step, try to merge the new interval to the last one we added.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1329"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the last and first ones.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
